intro: Adicea punctata, commonly known as the spotted adicea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
